name: DBpedia
description: Global and Unified Access to Knowledge Graphs.

projects.summary: A collection of ideas for projects suitable for participation in Google Summer of Code (GSoC) 2025.
Implementation of CSS styles for both dark and light color schemes in web design.
Defines an SVG loader animation utilizing keyframes and varying styles for visual loading indicators.

jina_response:
Title: Topics tagged gsoc2025-ideas

URL Source: https://forum.dbpedia.org/tag/gsoc2025-ideas

Markdown Content:
:root { --animation-state: paused; } /\* user picked a theme where the "regular" scheme is dark \*/ /\* user picked a theme a light scheme and also enabled a dark scheme \*/ /\* deal with light scheme first \*/ @media (prefers-color-scheme: light) { :root { --primary: #222222; --secondary: #ffffff; --tertiary: #4b6584; --quaternary: #4b6584; --highlight: #fee291; --success: #009900; } } /\* then deal with dark scheme \*/ @media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) { :root { --primary: #222222; --secondary: #ffffff; --tertiary: #4b6584; --quaternary: #4b6584; --highlight: #fee291; --success: #009900; } } /\* these styles need to live here because the SVG has a different scope \*/ .dots { animation-name: loader; animation-timing-function: ease-in-out; animation-duration: 3s; animation-iteration-count: infinite; animation-play-state: var(--animation-state); stroke: #fff; stroke-width: 0.5px; transform-origin: center; opacity: 0; r: max(1vw, 11px); cy: 50%; filter: saturate(2) opacity(0.85); } .dots:first-child { fill: var(--quaternary); } .dots:nth-child(2) { fill: var(--quaternary); animation-delay: 0.15s; } .dots:nth-child(3) { fill: var(--highlight); animation-delay: 0.3s; } .dots:nth-child(4) { fill: var(--tertiary); animation-delay: 0.45s; } .dots:nth-child(5) { fill: var(--tertiary); animation-delay: 0.6s; } @keyframes loader { 0% { opacity: 0; transform: scale(1); } 45% { opacity: 1; transform: scale(0.7); } 65% { opacity: 1; transform: scale(0.7); } 100% { opacity: 0; transform: scale(1); } } ![Image 1: DBpedia Forum](blob:https://forum.dbpedia.org/97820444a9f18ff8e0ca9d289ebd7eec)
